entry.title: and still, i came back (to you)
entry.summary:
Author: xyluem

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,625Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 27

Summary: You were never the type to dislike change. You didn’t complain when your family moved to Metropolis for your parents’ new jobs when you were ten. You didn’t panic when one of your drone test runs accidentally trapped Superman of all people. You didn’t even flinch when he offered you a smile, curious rather than angry, offering something that sounded suspiciously like a partnership. You adapted. You learned. You thrived. To you, becoming Superman’s sidekick was just another challenge to figure out. One moment you were tinkering in your garage; the next, you were upgrading the security systems and arguing with Justice League AI systems that didn’t understand sarcasm. You were fine with all of it.You were fine with everything. Until the day you were sent back to Gotham. Back to the city that never truly forgot you. Back to the shadows you’d unknowingly left behind—and the damage you never realized you caused. Because Gotham remembers. And the ghosts here don’t stay buried. (mostly jason todd/reader and tim drake/reader, but has slightly yj member including superboy, wonder girl, and impulse/reader)

entry.title: The Garden and the Gun
entry.summary:
Author: Knight_Ana

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,763Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 2

Summary: Gotham City — but not the high-rise chaos we usually see. The story focuses on a small, older neighborhood just outside Crime Alley. It’s rough around the edges but alive — full of community, old shops, and people trying to do good in a rotting city. (y/n) works in a flower shop run by an elderly couple who treat them like family. They also volunteer at a local community center, helping street kids and runaways — some of whom have been directly affected by Gotham’s gang wars.

entry.title: Moon-Lights Embrace
entry.summary:
Author: Neriumssmut

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,945Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Jason Todd hears rumors that The Scarecrow has been metaling with a new fear formula that would be able to tap into a person's dream physically. Changing it into whatever he wants and also being able to keep them there in his own personal nightmare playground. Jason knows Batman will only try and take him into custody again once he hears of it and he's had enough of the back and forth with the same villains. Scarecrow wants nothing but death and suffering and that's exactly what he's gonna get.Ayla Rivens, otherwise known as Dusk, a survivor turned avenger, Dusk is a ruthless, dream-walking vigilante with a personal vendetta against Scarecrow. Her powers make her a formidable force, but her methods are as dark as the nightmares she controls.

entry.title: Apartment 3B
entry.summary:
Author: ElaineInABox

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,156Chapters: 5/15Kudos: 154

Summary: You weren’t looking for love, just somewhere cheap, quiet, and safe enough to get you through the semester. Jason Todd wasn’t looking for company, just a roommate who wouldn’t ask questions about why he came home at two AM bloody and bruised.But in a cramped apartment in Crime Alley, between burnt coffee, leaky ceilings, and the soft hum of the city that never sleeps, the silence between you starts to change. What begins as survival becomes something quieter, steadier—something that almost feels like home.

entry.title: Marigolds and Apple Blossoms
entry.summary:
Author: nocteris

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,094Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 33

Summary: His two brothers stared at him. “Are you gonna swipe right or…” Dick trailed off.  He stared back.  Damian tutted, “Are you implying my sister is not good enough for you, Todd?” Jason laughed, oh it was quite the opposite. “You think I’m good enough for her, kid?” --- Where Jason and the reader were the closest growing up in the Wayne family, but are oblivious to each other's feelings. When Barbara snitches on Jason being on a dating app, the family schemes together to get the two idiots blindly in love together. Fluff, angst, and everything in between ensues.

entry.title: Haunted by the Thought of You
entry.summary:
Author: BoggieBoat

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,715Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 8

Summary: Ghosts aren't real. Every story ever told about one is just clearly made up just to get a rise out of anyone who would listen to such an idiotic tale- especially the one currently circling throughout Gotham Academy. After all, why would a murderous, vengeful spirit of a teacher possibly haunt a school for the rest of eternity and claim students' lives for something that happened generations ago? And, no, Damian Wayne is not scared- he's a trained assassin and fights crime with Batman almost every night! Why would an old urban legend possibly ruffle the Robins' feathers? Even the teacher he told the story to thought that it was ridiculous!Why he is the only person who's able to see them is irrelevant. Don't ask.

entry.title: Strangers in the Night
entry.summary:
Author: unnamedmystery

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,383Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 201

Summary: When the Daily Planet heard word of a new vigilante in Crime Alley that supposedly had no affiliation with Batman, Perry White thought it to be a nice short story—a quick in and out. After all, while the people of Metropolis had Superman, everyone knew of Batman, and a vigilante not working with him seemed interesting. At least, that’s what Perry told his college intern. And her mentor Clark Kent when he raised concerns. No one told her that the vigilante was intimidatingly attractive. Or that Crime Alley was the worse place in Gotham City. Or that her mentor would ask a friend to keep tabs on her. Or that the detective she’s staying with hates Batman despite working with him frequently. Or that the detectives neighbor was a really cute guy.
